page.title: 13TOURISM,CAREW AREA,TENBY.
page.content: { The main attraction in the area is {Carew Castle.}Many believe it is the most attractive castle in S.W.Wales. It lies halfway between Tenby and Pembroke, in a picturesque setting alongside the mill pond. There is an intersting walk around the castle where one can see an ancient{Celtic Cross}and a restored example of a{French tidal mill.}There is a pleasant{picnic area}opposite the castle at the water's edge. { Bird watchers can enjoy both estuary {and woodland species. Carew village is attractive, one of its old cottages having a{Flemish {chimney.}There are{2 tea gardens}in Carew and a{public house_'The Carew {Inn'.}Other public houses in the area are{'Milton Brewery'}and{'Plough Inn'. { Carew Sunday Market}is a big attraction for visitors.
